alert.note: Alert for Dale; Henry (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 10:50AM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Dale and Henry Counties in southeastern Alabama, Clay, southern Randolph, northern Calhoun, northwestern Early and southwestern Terrell Counties in southwestern Georgia through 1245 PM EDT/1145 AM CDT/... At 1150 AM EDT/1050 AM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Fort Gaines to near Ariton. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Abbeville, Fort Gaines, Cuthbert, Ozark, Fort Novosel, Edison, Shellman, Ariton, Newville, Bellville, Haleburg, Bluffton, Shorterville, Parksville, Carnegie, Hayes, Watson Crossroads, Scottsboro Crossroads, Ricks Place and Pecan. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
